body:
Comment 2 by **sladegen**: 
That's an absolutely silly request. Ed has been part of basic "/bin" package of 
every major Linux distribution since... like forever. Its presence on *nix like 
system can be relied on upon the same way as on existence of basic file handling 
commands like "cp", "rm", "chown" or "cat" for that matter. I'm not sure but it may 
even be contained in POSIX standard. It's YOU who is exceptional here not Golang 
team. Ed is not obsolete. Is usage of sed by configure scripts obsolete because 
"nowadays" simple regex substitution, and more, can be done with Perl? How 
unreasonable would it be to demand much larger in terms of disk space dependence on 
Perl when the job can be done with a single 70kB binary?
